# Task

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.



# Data

extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""")

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    julia_code_block = r"```julia[\s\S]*?```"m
    # Match all occurrences of Julia code blocks in the markdown document
    matches = eachmatch(julia_code_block, md)
    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""
    # Iterate over matches and extract the code inside the code block
    for match in matches
        # Get the captured group (the code inside the code block)
        code = match.captures[1]
        # Remove the leading and trailing `\n` characters from the code
        code = strip(code, '\n')
        # Append the code to the extracted_code string with a newline
        extracted_code *= "$code\n"
    end
    return extracted_code
end

# Test the function with an example provided in the task
extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""") == "println(\"hello world\")\n"
